metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5838 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The gst_date_time_new_from_iso8601_string function in gst/gstdatetime.c in GStreamer before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap read) via a malformed datetime string.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5838` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gstreamer-1.0 - 1.10.3-1ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-tools - 1.10.3-1ubuntu1
libgstreamer1.0-0 - 1.10.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gstreamer1.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3-1ubuntu1').
